name: PDA Dad UK
description: I'm the father of an autistic girl with #PDA #autism #autismdad #thebarriersweface #invisibleillness #autismawareness #spectrum #asd #aspergers
tweet:
1. Keep calm yourself. It's so important as increased stress from me is picked up on from her
2. Ensure area is safe - nothing to throw or people to hurt 
3. Redirect. Fund something soothing (sensory toy?) or different to distract https://t.co/LxZLCbSoA1

name: PDA Dad UK
description: I'm the father of an autistic girl with #PDA #autism #autismdad #thebarriersweface #invisibleillness #autismawareness #spectrum #asd #aspergers
tweet:
One thing we really struggle with is meltdowns. They can be sudden and dangerous. But I've been looking at hyperfocus and flow states and how we can use them to alleviate anxiety that leads to meltdowns 👍 #autism #pda

https://t.co/I8JO4ibgV8

name: PDA Dad UK
description: I'm the father of an autistic girl with #PDA #autism #autismdad #thebarriersweface #invisibleillness #autismawareness #spectrum #asd #aspergers
tweet:
@PDArebellion @ColgateUK You're right. But this to me cuts deeper. It's applying a label to all our kids and indeed to someone such as yourself. You're autistic, but that doesn't make you troubled. 

Language is so difficult as, as you say, so many will interpret it differently and take offence....

name: PDA Dad UK
description: I'm the father of an autistic girl with #PDA #autism #autismdad #thebarriersweface #invisibleillness #autismawareness #spectrum #asd #aspergers
tweet: @PDArebellion @ColgateUK You're likely right, however this needs to be made clear. The issue is that of labelling all people with a neurodiversity as being "troubled". My daughter's autistic, but not troubled...if that makes sense ☺️

tweet:
@GrumpyDadsPod @CharlieL28 @Beth_Tastic @TheRealGrumpDad 6. What can happen then, 
according to the latest research on the extraordinarily complex immune issues in a ME/CFS pts, 
is that the immune system never self-regulates after that and gets *stuck* in that overactive state,
 attacking cells.

name: PDA Dad UK
description: I'm the father of an autistic girl with #PDA #autism #autismdad #thebarriersweface #invisibleillness #autismawareness #spectrum #asd #aspergers
tweet:
@GrumpyDadsPod @CharlieL28 @Beth_Tastic @TheRealGrumpDad 5. The third stage is the body making antibodies to protect your body against the virus. This is what you want. 

Unfortunately, in ME/CFS patients, the immune response to Vs can throw the immune system into turmoil, especially when it is already in a dysfunctional state.

name: PDA Dad UK
description: I'm the father of an autistic girl with #PDA #autism #autismdad #thebarriersweface #invisibleillness #autismawareness #spectrum #asd #aspergers
tweet: @GrumpyDadsPod @CharlieL28 @Beth_Tastic @TheRealGrumpDad 4. Bear in mind, ME/CFS patients already have a high-load of circulating cytokines, so this can be a *big* reaction after the V shot: achiness, flu-like symptoms, even greater exhaustion, early stage of anaphylaxis."

name: PDA Dad UK
description: I'm the father of an autistic girl with #PDA #autism #autismdad #thebarriersweface #invisibleillness #autismawareness #spectrum #asd #aspergers
tweet: @BluemoonShell I'm not meaning it to be sexist - but the fact is that issues like masking are more prevalent in girls. A big part of the issue is that girls (due to masking often) make better eye contact and appear more socially adept (by NT standards). This means professionals miss the traits

name: PDA Dad UK
description: I'm the father of an autistic girl with #PDA #autism #autismdad #thebarriersweface #invisibleillness #autismawareness #spectrum #asd #aspergers
tweet: @draevans ... People not dealing with these issues have no concept of just how isolating it is. How you can feel so alone and so helpless. Just having someone tell you you're doing a great job can be the difference between a good or bad day

name: PDA Dad UK
description: I'm the father of an autistic girl with #PDA #autism #autismdad #thebarriersweface #invisibleillness #autismawareness #spectrum #asd #aspergers
tweet: @draevans So sooo this! It's why we do what we do here and on our other social media platforms. I run a FB group for parents of autistic kids and we hit 20k members a few weeks ago. I asked for feedback and was stunned that almost every response said "I no longer feel alone"...

name: PDA Dad UK
description: I'm the father of an autistic girl with #PDA #autism #autismdad #thebarriersweface #invisibleillness #autismawareness #spectrum #asd #aspergers
tweet: @draevans Absolutely. It is, in fact, a privilege. It's hard, no question, but the big man entrusted these lives to us. It's an amazing road but it does need support

name: PDA Dad UK
description: I'm the father of an autistic girl with #PDA #autism #autismdad #thebarriersweface #invisibleillness #autismawareness #spectrum #asd #aspergers
tweet: If the current news is showing anything it's that our current care system is failing kids and families. Not condoning the actions taken, but it highlights the needs being ignored https://t.co/zwmxxfT54L #autism #AutisticLivesMatter

name: PDA Dad UK
description: I'm the father of an autistic girl with #PDA #autism #autismdad #thebarriersweface #invisibleillness #autismawareness #spectrum #asd #aspergers
tweet: @draevans Definitely agree. My point is that we all have a breaking point. Clearly murder is WRONG...but so many are are reaching their own breaking points - depression, self harm, despair, feelings of worthlessness. Our kids lives, and our own, are being made so much harder wrongly

name: PDA Dad UK
description: I'm the father of an autistic girl with #PDA #autism #autismdad #thebarriersweface #invisibleillness #autismawareness #spectrum #asd #aspergers
tweet: @draevans Absolutely not condoning murder and disgusted. But I think the sympathy is due to the clear need for support leading up to this being ignored. It should not have happened in this society and it's exposing a massive flaw in the support systems in place

name: PDA Dad UK
description: I'm the father of an autistic girl with #PDA #autism #autismdad #thebarriersweface #invisibleillness #autismawareness #spectrum #asd #aspergers
tweet: THREAD - 5. people who claim benefits for the right reasons. They're there for a reason. We're not all bludgers. Most of us are saving the NHS and the country millions of £££ by getting paid a pittance for 100hr weeks. It deserves a pat on the back not judgement!

name: PDA Dad UK
description: I'm the father of an autistic girl with #PDA #autism #autismdad #thebarriersweface #invisibleillness #autismawareness #spectrum #asd #aspergers
tweet: THREAD - 4. thing. I'M A #CARER now. I'm proud of my job. It's my career. And I do it better than anyone else. The alternative is someone would get paid 10x what I get for the same job. My wife would be in care. My daughter would be in care. My son would be alone. DON'T JUDGE...

name: PDA Dad UK
description: I'm the father of an autistic girl with #PDA #autism #autismdad #thebarriersweface #invisibleillness #autismawareness #spectrum #asd #aspergers
tweet: THREAD - 3. I have a young son too who needs to be cared for and loved. My day ends at 11pm when everyone is finally settled and I actually get a moment to me. #mentalhealth has had a huge impact but you know what...I'm glad I do it now. I'm proud to be a carer. And that's the..

name: PDA Dad UK
description: I'm the father of an autistic girl with #PDA #autism #autismdad #thebarriersweface #invisibleillness #autismawareness #spectrum #asd #aspergers
tweet: THREAD - 2. In the end I was told by key workers I needed to focus on my families #mentalhealth and become a carer. I did this. My day starts at 6am when my #actuallyautistic daughter gets up. I have to control the meds as they're a risk to my #bipolardisorder wife...

name: PDA Dad UK
description: I'm the father of an autistic girl with #PDA #autism #autismdad #thebarriersweface #invisibleillness #autismawareness #spectrum #asd #aspergers
tweet: THREAD - 1. I hate that I have to claim #carers. I was left with no other choice. I had to leave my job as constantly being dragged away wasn't fair on my employer. So I set up my own business. But that left me letting down clients when crises happened at home...

name: PDA Dad UK
description: I'm the father of an autistic girl with #PDA #autism #autismdad #thebarriersweface #invisibleillness #autismawareness #spectrum #asd #aspergers
tweet:
...a scrounger. They give us a bad name. 

To balance I have taken volunteer spots where I can. I do the school crossing as a volunteer. I'm a school governor. I'm trying to give back where I can. 

Props to all of you #carers doing the same and making life better for loved ones

name: PDA Dad UK
description: I'm the father of an autistic girl with #PDA #autism #autismdad #thebarriersweface #invisibleillness #autismawareness #spectrum #asd #aspergers
tweet:
...I also dispense meds, make sure everyone is safe, keep my eye out for warning signs like self- harm or worse. If a professional was to do my job they would get paid 10x what I do. 

I hate benefit scroungers. They're cheating the system. But not everyone on benefits is...

name: PDA Dad UK
description: I'm the father of an autistic girl with #PDA #autism #autismdad #thebarriersweface #invisibleillness #autismawareness #spectrum #asd #aspergers
tweet: ... My family need me at times that aren't convenient for work. My daughter's #autistic and my wife is #bipolar, EUPD and epileptic. I do the school runs. I do all meals. I do all cleaning. I do all shopping. I get the occasional break but it's in the middle of the day...

name: PDA Dad UK
description: I'm the father of an autistic girl with #PDA #autism #autismdad #thebarriersweface #invisibleillness #autismawareness #spectrum #asd #aspergers
tweet: THREAD - I've seen some posts about people's rights to benefits when they're either #actuallyautistic or caring for #autistic people. I'm a carer. I'm a carer because professionals told me I needed to be. I would much rather still be running my business but I'm needed at home...

name: PDA Dad UK
description: I'm the father of an autistic girl with #PDA #autism #autismdad #thebarriersweface #invisibleillness #autismawareness #spectrum #asd #aspergers
tweet: @AutismHoodjay We use melatonin for my daughter. I was hesitant to medicate but gp explained it thus - many autistic kids struggle to produce melatonin naturally and it's the body's natural sleep hormone. If we're low on vitamins we take a supplement. It's the same thing
